aggregations.name: Progressive Web App
aggregations.description: These audits validate the aspects of a Progressive Web App.

items.name: App can load on offline/flaky connections
items.description: Ensuring your web app can respond when the network connection is unavailable or flaky is critical to providing your users a good experience. This is achieved through use of a Service Worker.

manifest-start-url.description: Manifest's start_url is in cache storage for offline use

items.name: Page load performance is fast
items.description: Users notice if sites and apps don't perform well. These top-level metrics capture the most important perceived performance concerns.

touch-150ms.description: Touch input gets a response in < 150ms

fmp-no-jank.description: App is interactive without jank after the first meaningful paint

items.name: Site is progressively enhanced
items.description: Progressive enhancement means that everyone can access the basic content and functionality of a page in any browser, and those without certain browser features may receive a reduced but not unfunctioning experience.

items.name: Network connection is secure
items.description: Security is an important part of the web for both developers and users. Moving forward, Transport Layer Security (TLS) support will be required for many APIs.

items.name: User can be prompted to Add to Homescreen
items.description: While users can manually add your site to their homescreen in the browser menu, the prompt (aka app install banner) will proactively prompt the user to install the app if the below requirements are met and the user has visited your site at least twice (with at least five minutes between visits).

items.name: Installed web app will launch with custom splash screen
items.description: A default splash screen will be constructed, but meeting these requirements guarantee a high-quality and customizable splash screen the user sees between tapping the home screen icon and your appâ€™s first paint.

items.name: Address bar matches brand colors
items.description: The browser address bar can be themed to match your site. A theme-color meta tag will upgrade the address bar when a user browses the site, and the manifest theme-color will apply the same theme site-wide once it's been added to homescreen.

items.name: Design is mobile-friendly
items.description: Users increasingly experience your app on mobile devices, so it's important to ensure that the experience can adapt to smaller screens.

aggregations.name: Best Practices
aggregations.description: These audits do not affect your score but are worth a look.

serviceworker-push.description: Service worker makes use of push notifications, if appropriate

tap-targets.description: Tap targets are appropriately sized for touch

payments-autocomplete.description: Payment forms marked up with [autocomplete] attributes

login-autocomplete.description: Login forms marked up with [autocomplete] attributes

input-type.description: Input fields use appropriate [type] attributes for custom keyboards
